article:
The 'Integrated Services Digital Broadcasting' ('ISDB') (Japanese: , TÅgÅ
dijitaru hÅsÅ sÄbisu) is a Japanese standard for digital television (DTV) and
digital radio (DAB) used by the country's radio and Television networks. ISDB
replaced the previously used [[Multiple sub-Nyquist sampling encoding|MUSE]]
Hi-vision analogue HDTV system. A derivative of ISDB, [[ISDB-T
International]], was developed by the Brazilian government and is being widely
adopted in South America.
headings: 2.6 GHz Mobile satellite digital audio/video broadcasting
